title: Large-Scale Online Mathematics Leadership Development Program for Volunteer Sector Leaders

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts comprehension and administrative management experience
context.additional_context: Emphasizing Mathematical Decision-Making Competencies for the Efficient Operation of Volunteer Activities

learning_goals: Perform basic statistical analysis required for volunteer project budget planning.

Within one week, learners design a linear programming (LP)-based resource allocation optimization model in a three-person team project using real-time collaboration tools (e.g., Google Colab), and submit simulation results proving an objective function achievement rate of 85% or higher under given constraints (budget, time, personnel).

Within one week, learners select three or more measurement indicators (volunteer hours, participation rate, social impact) using smartphone-based tools (Google Forms, Excel Mobile, etc.), and write a 1â€“2-page performance measurement plan specifying data collection methods for each indicator.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
